title: Needs Update
comment: This used to be a great browser.  Does not play well with Lollipop. Does not recognize phone numbers and does not launch Maps when an address is selected. No updates since Nov 2014! May be abandoned by developer? Anyway deleted and using stock Lollipop browser on my GS5.
I've not abandoned it.  I've just been a bit bussy.  I will be working on an update soon

title: Great browser
comment: A fast and lightweight browser, favorite one so far. Only suggestion would be some sort of an undo option if we accidentally close tabs and such.

title: Favourite browser
comment: Does need an update though, it doesn't handle app links all that well (Aptoide, Google maps etc.). It gives an error as opposed to opening the app.
I like the browser and the layout but few minor glitches one can't photo comment on Facebook or any other sites and can't watch videos

comment: i cannot download the images that i wanted, this is really dissatisfying, because i think it is a very cute app.... im hurt.👿

title: Sleek and Fast browser!
comment: Does what it says, and also liking the material design.

title: opening tabs
comment: needs to have a function that allows u to open new tabs without automatically switching to that tab

title: Lightnening fast
comment: Great coding. Very fast, light on RAM and so far no crashes.

title: LIGHT, CLEAN, FAST GORGEOUS,
comment: ONLY 2 BASIC PERMISSIONS REQUIRED!

title: 5 Stars
comment: It's better than a 4 so I give it a 5. I just discovered Lucid and gave it a Test Drive on both my phone and a large tablet like HP Slate. I have tested a bunch of different browsers and this is the first one that works out really great on both devices. Some of the web pages load up a little nicer in desktop mode on my HP than it does using my other go to browser(Dolphin). I can get the fonts big enough using Lucid so a legally blind person could read. User interface, customization, ease of use, etc. is all quite to my liking so far. I will probably be a buyer for the ad free version of this browser. I just did an additional comparison to the Dolphin browser I was using for a few weeks... I played back video on Universal Sports.... Lucid browser played the video smooth and flawless while the Dolphin browser was playing back slowly, stalled and crashed once. My impressions are that this is the better browser. Facebook is a little buggy with the Lucid browser- having trouble clicking to chat and new comments in the top menu bar... that would be the only fault I have found so far.
Immensive UI
Overall good but some sites could be blocked by cellular operator

title: Open in background tab?
comment: Hey can i request open new tab on backgrounds? And some easy tab switching?.  Thx this browser is fast even on my almost 5 years old android.
Not bad. Small & fast. Like it.

title: Super fast and super awesome!:D
comment: Havent tested flash yet,but this is super amazing. Thanks for developing!:D

title: Best Browser Ever!!
comment: Light, simple and so fast!  The design is just perfect! Bought the pro version! Love it!

title: Small and snappy
comment: Great little browser. Basic, light and quick. Only problem I've had so far is that touches used to be really inaccurate. This has suddenly fixed, either due to an update or a newer build of lollipop. This is one the best browsers!
Glad to hear it!

title: Nice
comment: Keep it up, dev.  This browser will go places.  Good work!
Thanks my friend!

title: Exit button..?
comment: It's fast browser. But where is quit option?
pull out the sidebar drawer on the right of the screen and scroll down to the bottom and you will see the exit button :)
This is a very good browser! My only complaint is I wish I had tried it earlier.

title: Works very well
comment: On Nexus 7 & Moto X both on Android 4.4.4 (ART) works great.  One problem is when I come across apps that stupidly put menu items on the app shelf at bottom of screen, the immersive nature of the capacitive buttons in lucid browser makes it difficult to select these items.

title: Incomplete.
comment: It would be very nice if you could download stuff. But no way to download with this browser. If you could do that it would be good.

title: Won't autospace on Facebook text boxes.
comment: Other browsers do but not this one or the default browser. It's something to do with the box being considered a url box. Please fix!

title: So it doesn't save any History?
comment: I had tabs open and after changing some settings my tabs disappeared. I wanted to get them back from my History but it's nowhere to be found... Where can I find it?
Love the ui

title: Lucid browser
comment: Love it

title: Fast, Efficient Browser

so light and fast.... how is this possible? love the translucent ui. no incognito mode yet though.

title: Brilliant Browser
comment: I really like this browser and would like to make a suggestion. Is it possible that you could make the home screen wallpaper apparent when opening the browser or clicking home, as an option please? This effect can be currently be achieved by closing all the tabs but keeping the side bar open.

title: Great yet hot?
comment: Amazing browser, everything I could want in an incredibly light package. I'm using it as my main browser but it warms my HTC one up quite a bit after awhile. I thought it was because of the transparency showing my live wallpaper at first but going to a solid color hasn't fixed it. It seems the LW is still being rendered beneath the app anyway, can this be fixed somehow? Also would love to see am auto-hiding URL bar! Great browser though keep up the good work!
Most of these browsers work great until facebook happens to them.

title: Wonderful
comment: Works great, extremely tiny and fast

title: really nice
comment: Fast, lightweight and stable, yet I'm unhappy with the font sizes, size 2 is too big and size 1 is too small. If you could add a value between these, it would be really great, since it's not comfortable like this for me.

title: URL in continuous loop. Android 4.1.2
comment: Tried rebooting, same situation. Tried on tablet android 4.2.1 will not accept bookmarks.  App . needs work.

title: Brilliant simple browser
comment: This is such a simple, easy to use, light browser which I currently favor over Chrome due to its simplicity. Love how natural it feels to swipe from right to see tabs and menu. Great app!

title: Great design,
comment: very quick, but can't import bookmarks. Would love to see a quick settings option like in the stock ICS browser.

title: Awesome
comment: Light speed tiny browser..

title: A few thigs need fixing.
comment: Back and forward buttons are a bit delayed. When back is press it should take you to where you were in the previous page, and not back to the top. I've noticed it's slowing down. Downloads have also stopped working. When I choose to save an image for example, it takes a while, then says the image is saved, but it doesn't really happen. I will give back 2 stars and a more positive review if you guys can fix this without making this worse.

Currently Lucid Browser needs the system "Downloads" app to download files. If you have removed that app via root, you may need to re-install it. About saving images; have you checked the exact directory it shows it has saved to?

title: Great for low-end devices.
comment: >1 MB App, Fast and open source? Why not!

title: Great for now
comment: Everything is working smooth and nice but it would be cool if the fullscreen mode would hide the adress/action bar and keep the status bar and scrolling up (or pressing implemented menu button next to recent apps button) would bring the adress/action bar up. And also if you could improve page scrolling a bit it would be great...the scrolling is smooth but leaves the page white for a second if scrolling very fast...not a huge problem but could be solved i believe. Keep up the good work :)

title: Great app
comment: The browser is really awesome. There are so many browsers on the market that pack their app so full of unnecessary features for myself, and I find this browser is amazingly minimalistic. I recommend it for anyone that just wants a fast and lightweight browser. Its also open source which is nice.

title: ALMOST perfect.
comment: I've been looking for a browser that functions smoothly on my crappy phone and this fits the bill. Not only that but it's well designed. Two big flaws that stand out are: it doesn't seem to know what to do with phone number (and YouTube) links and there is no download list. If you start a download and then want to cancel... there's no apparent way. Fix these issues and it'll be my primary browser.
Thanks for the suggestions. Phone number links will work in the next update. YouTube links should already be working...
